intro: Adenophora wawreana f. polytricha, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in cooler climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branched. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive floral display.
